MEDIAN_AGE: The median age is associated with a positive effect on the number of crime incidents. For each increase of 1 year, number of incidents increases on average by 2252."
T_STAT: The t-statistic associated to the median age is about 1.820. It is computed as follows : t = (sample average - theoretical average)/(sample standard deviation * square root(sample size))
P_VALUE: p-value is up to 0.05 so it is not statistically significant enough at the 95% confidence level nor at the 90% confidence level.
INCREASE: the total number of incidents decrease about 2115 when the share of families with a married couple increases by 1 percentage point in the district.
LIMITATIONS: They are correlations between the differents variables, mostly about ages.
